results.title: The Birdcage
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Armand (Robin Williams) and Albert (Nathan Lane) have created their own piece of serenity with their successful nightclub, “The Birdcage”. Armand takes care of the management and Albert performs nightly as the wonderful female impersonator, Starina. Their world is thrown into disarray when Armand’s son announces he is engaged to a conservative Senator’s daughter who is eager to meet their future son in laws parents. It will take all of Albert’s stage experience to convince the future in laws they are a ‘normal’ family. This reworking of the classic French farce ‘La Cage aux Folles’ will delight viewers with it sparkling humour and great performances by Robin Williams, Nathan Lane, Hank Azaria, Gene Hackman, Dianne Wiest, Dan Futterman and Calista Flockhart.

results.title: The Big Lebowski
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: The plot of this Raymond Chandleresque comedy-drama crime caper from the Coen Brothers pivots around a case of mistaken identity. Unemployed and laid-back, 70s refugee Jeff “The Dude” Lebowski likes hanging out with his friends and bowling. His life takes an alternate route when two thugs break into his home and soil his rug in the belief that they are accosting Jeff Lebowski, the Pasadena millionaire. The Dude looks up his wealthy namesake and manages to get a replacement for his soiled rug, but he also manages to embroil himself in a story of extortion, double-cross, deception, embezzlement, sex and dope. Cast includes Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi, Ben Gazzara and John Turturro.

results.title: The Belly of an Architect
results.brief_description: This is the story of a distinguished American architect, Stanley Kracklite, who goes to Rome’s Museum and Mausoleum of Western Art, to put on an exhibition in memory of his hero, the 18th century visionary, French architect, Etienne Louis Boullee. Kracklite becomes more and more preoccupied with his work and obsessed with his health, and in doing so alienates his wife. The visual style of the film aims for a continual background of architecture to indicate that man is persistently lost in its shadow.

results.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
results.creator_credit: Leo McCarey, Rainbow Educational Video and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A battle of wits emerges between Father O’Malley and Sister Benedict when their ideas clash in how the children should be taught at St. Mary’s School. However, Sister Benedict takes a tip from his unusual methods and buys a boxing book and a baseball bat, then finds herself in the business of making men out of boys. It’s not Father O’Malley’s only battle. The school is badly in need of repairs and a cynical millionaire has started proceedings to condemn the school building. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Bing Crosby.

results.title: The Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description: This full length version of one of the most important films in the history of silent cinema portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. It brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: The Battle of Russia
results.creator_credit: Anatole Litvak, Frank Capra and United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Why we fight”.
This epic film unfolds the great history of Russia, and the defeat of Hitler’s Nazi armies. The depiction of the mightiest battle in war history, with a human life toll of 20 million Russians and 10 million Germans, becomes more than a first hand record of war; it is also an ode to a people’s courage and self sacrifice, and the end of Hitler’s “Mein Kampf”. Historic film sequences of “The Seige of Leningrad” features the miracle of a “frozen lake” which becomes a rescue highway for a city surrounded and doomed, an event which turned the tide of World War II.

results.title: The Battle of Midway
results.creator_credit: John Ford and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Why we fight”.
John Ford’s Academy Award winning documentary filmed during the Battle of Midway. Narration combines with visuals of the naval air battle, hospitalization of the injured and burial services in a patriotic tribute to the people from the United States battling the Japanese. Suitable for Tertiary level students.

results.title: The Band Wagon
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A has-been Hollywood dancer joins forces with a temperamental stage producer to put on a Broadway musical. “The Band Wagon” has a witty, original screenplay, with some of the most exciting musical numbers ever put on film. Stars Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse with Jack Buchanan, Oscar Levant and Nanette Fabray.

results.title: The Ballad of Cable Hogue
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Warner Bros Pictures and Phil Feldman Productions
results.brief_description: The Battle of Cable Hogue is a departure from Peckinpah’s repertoire of bloodshed and is instead an affectionate tribute to the fading old West which is represented by Cable Hogue (Jason Robards). By 1908 the old west has progressed, and frontiersman Hogue has managed to survive while maintaining his old ways. Hogue makes a living from selling water from a spring he accidentally stumbled across while near death in the desert. He sets up “shop” at a rest stop along the stage coach line, however past and present tensions arise when Hogue’s livelihood is threatened by the advent of automobiles replacing stagecoaches. Cast also includes Stells Stevens, David Warner, Strother Martin and Slim Pickens.

results.title: The Back of Beyond
results.creator_credit: Roland Robinson, Janet Heyer, John Heyer and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Heyer’s romantic impression of life in the inland of Australia featuring the Birdsville Track and its postman, Tom Kruse. Highlights the isolation of the people on outback stations and small towns, and the importance in their lives of the postman and the pedal wireless. Notable in the history of documentary for its strong visuals and use of natural speech, and for being the first production of the Shell Film Unit in Australia. Commentary spoken by Kevin Brennan.
